Pathological Disbelief
Brian Josephson

"Marcello Truzzi asserted at one time that 'extraordinary claims require extraordinary evidence', but later decided the concept was incoherent. In fact, the evidence that changes minds is often quite ordinary: what is of relevance is the psychological factors that may inhibit acceptance of the evidence."
